conversation.label: Dr. Wilson:
conversation.phrase: Do you think he was dead? Do you think those experiences were real?
conversation.name: Dr. Wilson

conversation.label: Dr. House:
conversation.phrase: Define real. They were real experiences. What they meant... Personally, I choose to believe that the white light people sometimes see, visions, this patient saw. They're all just chemical reactions that take place when the brain shuts down.
conversation.name: Dr. House
Dr. House
conversation.phrase: There's no conclusive science. My choice has no practical relevance to my life, I choose the outcome I find more comforting.
conversation.label: Dr. House:

conversation.phrase: You find it more comforting to believe that this is it?
conversation.name: Dr. Cameron
conversation.label: Dr. Cameron:

conversation.phrase: I find it more comforting to believe that this isn't simply a test.
conversation.name: Dr. House
conversation.label: Dr. House:

conversation-text:
Dr. Wilson: Do you think he was dead? Do you think those experiences were real?
Dr. House: Define real. They were real experiences. What they meant... Personally, I choose to believe that the white light people sometimes see, visions, this patient saw. They're all just chemical reactions that take place when the brain shuts down.
Dr. Foreman: You choose to believe that?
Dr. House: There's no conclusive science. My choice has no practical relevance to my life, I choose the outcome I find more comforting.
Dr. Cameron: You find it more comforting to believe that this is it?
Dr. House: I find it more comforting to believe that this isn't simply a test.
